Package com.lloseng.ocsf.client

Class ObservableSWRClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.lloseng.ocsf.client.ObservableClient
        • com.lloseng.ocsf.client.ObservableSWRClient

  • public class ObservableSWRClient
extends ObservableClient
    This class acts as a subclass of AbstractClient and is also an Observable class. Each time a new message is received, observers are notified. This class contains two blocking methods that can be used when a user wishes to send a message and then wait for a reply from the server.
    Version:
    April 2002
    Author:
    Dr Robert Laganière

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • setWaitTime

        public void setWaitTime​(int waitTime)
        Sets the wait time. At the end of each wait time period, the instance will notify its observers with the WAITING_FOR_REPLY message.
        Parameters:
        waitTime - The wait time in ms.

      • connectAndWait

        public boolean connectAndWait​()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects to the server and waits. This method will block until the server confirm connection. At the end of each wait time period, the instance will notify its observers with the WAITING_FOR_REPLY message.
        Returns:
        true if successfully connected.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when connecting.
        java.lang.Exception

      • sendAndWaitForReply

        public java.lang.Object sendAndWaitForReply​(java.lang.Object message,
                                            java.lang.Object expectedObject)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sends a message to the server and waits for a reply. This method will block until the server sends the expected reply. At the end of each wait time period, the instance will notify its observers with the WAITING_FOR_REPLY message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message sends to the server.
        expectedObject - The client will wait until it receives an object equals to this one.
        Returns:
        the object received.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception

      • sendAndWaitForReply

        public java.lang.Object sendAndWaitForReply​(java.lang.Object message,
                                            java.util.List expectedListOfObject)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sends a message to the server and waits for a reply. This method will block until the server sends one of the expected list of replies. At the end of each wait time period, the instance will notify its observers with the WAITING_FOR_REPLY message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message sends to the server.
        expectedListOfObject - The client will wait until it receives an object equals to one of the objects in this list.
        Returns:
        the object received.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception

      • cancel

        public void cancel​()
        Cancels the exchange with the server.

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled​()
        Returns true if cancal has been called.
